data.title: Navigating Hollywood
data.text:
To submit your application for the NAVIGATING HOLLYWOOD Master Class, click the “APPLY TODAY” button. The class is offered on Wednesday nights at 6:00 PM (PST), and continues for 9 consecutive weeks. Each two-hour virtual session will cover a critical topic, followed by ample time for Q&A.

The topics include:

Access Hollywood - How to Break In and Break Through

The Art of the Pitch

Winning the Development Process

How to Develop and Maintain Your Biggest Asset: Your Own Authentic Voice

Writer’s Room Do’s and Don’ts

Agents, Managers, and Lawyers: Who, What, When, and How?

Art vs. Commerce: How to Bring the Right Content to Market

The Secret (and Successful) Life of Writers Who Rewrite Themselves

Selling to the Streamers

Thriving in the Face of a Million No’s

GUEST SPEAKERS WILL INCLUDE LEADING CREATIVES FROM THE FILM AND TELEVISION INDUSTRY!

Screenwriter DAVID AARON COHEN has been working in Hollywood for over 30 years. Among his many credits: THE DEVIL’S OWN, starring Harrison Ford and Brad Pitt, FRIDAY NIGHT LIGHTS, starring Billy Bob Thorton, and AMERICAN UNDERDOG, with Zachary Levi and Anna Paquin. In the course of his prolific career, Cohen has written studio and independent films, television pilots, and limited series. He currently has two tv shows in development at Sony and Lionsgate and just finished adapting the international best-seller MAN’S SEARCH FOR MEANING, by Viktor Frankl.

His one-of-a-kind master class, NAVIGATING HOLLYWOOD, will give a select group of students the practical, real-life tools they need to build and steer a writing career in the entertainment industry, all within a live Zoom classroom setting.
